text: - You never walk into a building, think,

"Oh, I wonder how the
HVAC system's doing."

Buildings are a huge
emitter of greenhouse gases.

It's one of the biggest
climate problems on our planet.

- Heating and cooling
systems represent half
of a building's energy consumption.
When we connect our technology

to these systems from
the cloud, we're able

to dynamically reduce their
energy consumption by 25%
and their emissions by up to 40%.

- [Interviewer] Could it
even be the kind of buildings
that we can see behind us?
- Oh, yeah, absolutely.
That would be a good example.

- We've, over the years,
developed this platform
with all the data infrastructure necessary
to do autonomous optimization,
and now we're layering on top
this generative AI virtual assistant

that is able to support
the building operators
or the facility managers in a way
that's real time, rich in data.

- BrainBox AI is building a
virtual building assistant based
on Amazon Bedrock,

and this assistant will enable
facilities professionals
around the world to connect
and interact with their buildings.
- It's an entirely new capability.
We're moving beyond business intelligence

where you're just getting
information fed to you

in an efficient manner
towards that virtual assistant
that starts doing its own reasoning
so that it's not just giving you a chart,

it's giving you a potential
answer on what the problem is

and where you should likely
go look and try to solve it.

- We have all of this
information in our platform,

so basically connecting the
generative AI's capabilities
to our unique and normalized dataset.

You know, you can't open
an off-the-shelf GPT
and ask it these questions

because it simply isn't
connected to these data sources.

- Using cutting-edge autonomous
artificial intelligence,
our goal is let's take these buildings,

let's transform them from
these blind energy consumers

to active participants in
this whole changing ecosystem.
- If you grab any BrainBox employee

and ask them why they're
there, they're likely going
to tell you they're motivated by
and committed to the mission
of decarbonizing the built environment
to save the planet with AI.
(lively music ending)
